name: Hermitage Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fabulous hotel! The room was spacious and relaxing. The food was delicious and the staff was helpful and personable. I will return for another visit.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is the place to stay with your pet. All the staff members are pet friendly and go out of their way to make you and your pet comfortable.
reviews.title: Our weekend could not have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an overnight stay at The Hermitage and could not have been more pleased. The hotel is beautiful and the service is wonderful without being stuffy or overbearing. When we arrived, our car was unloaded and parked for us; and the front desk had been notified of our arrival before we got there so check-in was fast. The room was very large for a city hotel and the bathroom was perfectly appointed with a large shower, a large tub and two sinks. The robes were wonderful too. The bed and linens perfect. We had a "short" walk to everything we wanted to visit and the concierge was happy to point the way. Breakfast at the Capitol Grille was delicious and the prices were reasonable (our breakfast was included in the package). We have stayed at many "luxury" hotels but this is one of our very favorites.
reviews.title: Worth every penny!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel. The room was spacious and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were only there one night but it was so relaxing we did not want to leave. The service was great and dinner at the hotel resturant was really good and the waiters were really helpful and personable.
reviews.title: Amazing Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for one night with our family (2 adults and 2 teenage children) in September 2011. We initially booked a room for 4 people, but they didn't have rooms for four! Before we could say "what's going on?", they told us that they had put us into adjoining rooms for no extra charge, greatly appreciated.
reviews.title: What great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was very easy and no problems, as was the taxi from the central train station - took about 10-15 minutes and only cost Euro12.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but be aware of location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor and they are really nice; each room had a king or two singles, a couch, coffee table and flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Disappointing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was nice and big and the vanity was large enough for my wife to spread all her toiletries out.
reviews.title: Classy and a bit posh, the photos don't do it justice. Very comfortable indeed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room looks nice - has a safe but couldn't find an iron, nice carpet, heavy drapes which keep out all the morning lights, timber panelling and the walls are finished with padded material - seems really posh and may sound funny, but in fact looks really good.
reviews.title: A bit old school but lovely enough
Creepy!!!!!!
reviews.text: From the minute we walked into this place it just looked and felt really old, cold and odd. I think this was some sort of institution at one time (a hospital ward, nursing home, something like that). Even the front doors, and doors in the hallways had tho7se big metal push panels you only find in places like that. There were only lights on in some areas that made the whole place dark and scary. They have these large common rooms for watching t.v., having breakfast, etc., (that's another reason for the nursing home reference) which were just so cold (linoleum floors, bright lights) that you really did not want to stay in any of them. There was a marble troth in the hallway off the lobby area, for what, I do not know, and probably don't want to know.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the room, it literally felt like a hospital room. No pictures on the walls, only two old nails sticking out, cracked paint on the walls, and scaffolding outside the window. I slept in my clothes because I despised the dirty beadspread and this place so much.
reviews.title: Lots of outlets, wood floors, good parking, clean & spacious rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO NOT STAY HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!
reviews.title: hermitage hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel deserves a review simply because our room had the most available outlets we've ever seen in a hotel room anywhere --about six or eight! So if two of you each have a laptop, phone & camera, etc. you're in luck. We didn't have to unplug the TV or a lamp to be able to plug in all our electronics. Unfortunately, there was no Internet in the rooms, which would have been handy since you could actually keep your laptop plugged in. (We were told Internet was available downstairs in the common area.) The room felt spacious. Although it was a typical style with small sleeping area with long entrance going past closet and bathroom, both the closet and bathroom were large so the "hallway" was longer than usual in our room. There was a suitcase rack as well as chairs around a small table. I liked the wooden floors, not real plank wood but nice enough and cleaner than sticky or worn carpets and warmer than tile. There was a small table outside our room with magazines--nice touch--and a large common room on main floor with giant screen TV on which someone was watching an Italian movie. We had to leave early before breakfast but the desk reception clerk kindly on his own brought us coffee. Hotel is hard to find at night, up some narrow streets, but the parking is good. Our room overlooked the parking lot and was very quiet. They advertise a "sea view" and I didn't actually check it in the morning light but I suspect our room had a partial sea view through other buildings.
reviews.title: Ok for 1 night - very helpful stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel has an own parking with enough places. The rooms are large. If you walk down the hill, you can catch the bus which takes you to the center in 15 minutes. It was not possible to shower or wash in the morning, because there came hardly any water out of the taps. Breakfast was not good at all. The hotel was a bit too far from the center to go there on foot.
reviews.title: served our purposes, very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family stayed for 2 nights on a road trip. Expensive but the level of service and quality of the rooms make it worth while, would recommend. Saw Dolly Parton in the restaurant which put the icing on the cake!
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Nashville!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Nashville for the first time last weekend and stayed at the Hermitage Hotel and had an absolutely wonderful experience. Our room was georgous, we had a junior suite with a view of the Capitol. The service was outstanding, the staff could not do enough for you from the time we arrived til the time we departed.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved Nashville and loved the hotel, can't wait to go back!!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful and so is the staff. The service is one of the best I have ever had and the hotel is very clean. It is located right by the state capital and just a few short blocks from music row. I would most definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel, very romantic, very well-done.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can support the other excellent reviews that have been posted on here. This is one of the best city centre hotels that I have stayed in, furnished to a very high standard with very professional staff throughout. It is the small touches that make the difference, such as lemonade and cookies set out free of charge for guests every afternoon.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Capital Grill is a fine restaurant, but prices were a little high particularly for wine, and the food good rather than exceptional. There are a number of good modern alternatives in Nashville, the concierge suggested Watermark, which was excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful Historic Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hermitage Hotel is a wonderful property that has managed to preserve days gone by yet is updated and modern. The hotel feels very polished and updated with out losing any of its historic charm. Too many hotels today get rid of the great things that make them special. The Hermitage has managed to keep their hotel special and very up todate.
reviews.title: This hotel defines classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location across from the state capitol and easy walk to the bars and restaurants downtown.
reviews.title: Luxury defined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel. It is a treat to stay here. There is a wonderful sense of old world Southern charm mixed with modern standards of service and amenities. Wonderful. I've stayed here twice and looking forward to the next stay already!
reviews.title: Best Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We travel pretty frequently (~once every 1-2 months) for business and have stayed in many 4-5 star hotels. Without hesitation, The Hermitage is one of the best places we have ever had to pleasure to stay! The overall facilities, service, and hospitality rival/exceed what we have experienced at other hotels such as the Ritz Carltonand Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Incredible hotel-exemplifies true luxury and service
Best Place To Stay
reviews.text: Pros

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1. Stunningly beautiful lobby impeccably maintained
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: 2. Rooms are large, spotlessly clean, with wonderfully luxurious linens (bed and towels) and Moulton Brown bath products.
reviews.title: The best hotel we've ever stayed at!
We "loved" The Peabody. We "ADORED" the Hermitage!
reviews.text: 3. Capitol Grille exceeds typical hotel restaurant fare. We had breakfast and lunch. In addition, we had dinner in the bar area and probably one of the best burgers ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You know you try to say good thing about people but the desk clerk would not direct you to any other service like restaurants, transportation, if the hotel provided it. Kinda of sad but the Hotel itself was clean but not a 4 star.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with OK service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Did not see much of the hotel as came to Milan to watch Arsenal. Staff were pleasant and accommodating, providing a twin room. Room was bit enough for a few of us to gather for a few drinks before the game. Only annoyance was not being able to get any sort of food after the game in the early hours, no 24 hour food options.
reviews.title: Good Deal - Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last week for 2 nights and found it to be absolutely brilliant, The hotel is in the chinatown area but could not fault it. My only minor points were that the room did not have tea/coffee facilities which I have never found before and one of the reception staff was a bit rude but other than that everything else was absolutely brilliant. the breakfast is of an excellent standard. And the staff at night in the restaurant were absolutely superb they could not do enough for you. So don't hesitate and book this hotel I recommend it 100%
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is located near to the Chinese quarter. To the Douma cathedral of 25 minutes on foot. The hotel sometimes offers good special offers on residing, in this case residing at hotel don't expensive. Breakfasts are simple. Cleaning is excellent.
reviews.title: not so far from old center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: i stayed at the hermitage for a city break in milan
reviews.title: nice hotel but more business than holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights for a business trip, nothing particularly good or bad about the hotel, Its old style, quite large and luxurious, large room, nice facilities, location isn't the best but walkable distance to the centre (about 25/30 min) and close to garibaldi area which is nice, internet speed is RIDICOLOUSLY slow and it costs 25 eur for 3 days. Friendly bar staff. I would go there again just because its behind my office but If it wasnt for the dustance Id rather stay at the NHOW. 130 eur 4 stars not too bad, just above average.
reviews.title: Not bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Milan. Busy city and busy area. Did not have great expectations going down the street but were delighted. Elegant room. Excellent breakfast. Lovely foyer and very helpful bar man. Finger food served with drinks.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - an oasis of calm and good service
Welcome to "Mee Laan"
reviews.text: The hotel is very nice and classy. Rooms are very well appointed, conference facilities are adequate and food is good as well. It well deserves 4 star classification.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However the area where the hotel is located has developed to be the heart of Milan's Chinatown. Not that this is really a problem, but it simply does not fit with the hotel itself, which caters amongst top sport and fashion stars. No nearby subway station.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Lovely hotel, poor location
reviews.text: If you do not mind about the surroundings, the hotel is definitely to be recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this Hotel - via Lastminute.com secret hotel - when we got the booking checked the review and was a little concerned about it being close to the Chinese Quarters. We went for 3 nights - for New Years celebration in Milan. The Hotel was excellent - as well as the area - yes the location is in "Chinese Quarter" - but the area is clean , vibrant , safe and within few minutes you are in an Italian Area - restaurants / bar and very close to the Hotel is a fabulous wine bar called Cantine Isola - where you can meet lost of Italians and also here you can buy great wines - or drink great wines
reviews.title: Really Great Value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Back to Hotel - great room - great service and really nice breakfast. The only thing missing is the lack of free access to WIFI. The receptionist recommended great restaurants. From the hotel you can get to the Duomo - which is the most centre you can get - by Tram / Bus - within 15 minutes. Take Tram No 1 - or Tram 19 - and you are in the Naviligia Area (near the Canal) etc - Train station / Metro Porta Garibaldi is also very close Bus 37 - three stops.
reviews.title: Good hotel near the centre of Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you get a good deal for this hotel - take it and you will enjoy it.
reviews.title: Business hotel in the chinese area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I spent a couple of nights in this hotel, it was a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Really liked it- very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is located near the centre of Milan. For those unfamiliar with the city, it is near via Paolo Sarpi. I read in a number of reviews this are labelled as "China Town", however readers should know that this is a relatively good and safe area in Milan. There is a populous Chinese community settled there, but this shouldn't deter anyone from choosing to stay here as this area is very convenient for most leisure and business requirements (near Garibaldi and Central Station, near the Fiera, and close to the hart of the city.
reviews.title: Elegant classic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel based on other reviews but did find it a little isolated when it came to eating out. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the sea, but all we found there was a pizzeria which was disappointing. We later discovered there's a very friendly nearby trattoria called (I think) Trattoria Anders (the hotel staff know it) which serves good food and specialises in fish.
reviews.title: A bit out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has an institutional feel to it (I could believe it was once a school as another reviewer mentioned) but is clean and spacious. Breakfast was good, and there is free off-street parking. All in all not a bad bet but I don't think I'd go back.
reviews.title: A comfortable hotel in a quiet location to the east of the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel located in a quiet location in the east of the city in a residential area that appeared safe. We arrived by taxi from the Brignole station for about 10 Euros. There are frequent buses (approximately every 15 minutes during week days, although the frequency is decreased in early morning and in the evening) that run from near the station to a stop about 100metres or so downhill from the hotel and another busline runs from another 100 metres or so further down the hill to the railway station's bus stop (check with hotel reception by email for the bus numbers prior to arriving if you are considering this option).
reviews.title: Absolutely no disturbance

likes.liked: — Very clean and quiet area of the city.
likes.disliked: — Nothing it was what I was looking for

description: Opened in 1910 The Hermitage Hotel is Tennessee's only Forbes Five Star and AAA Five Diamond Hotel. Reborn in 2003 The Hermitage Hotel is again a Sanctuary for travelers in the heart of Music City.
